follow_up_questions.selected_insight: Because charges are consistently highest for smokers across all regions, smoker status is a strong driver of higher insurance charges.

follow_up_questions.selected_insight: When comparing regions, non-smokers tend to be older in the northeast, while smokers tend to be older in the southwest, indicating regional age differences by smoker status.

follow_up_questions.rationale: Although non-smokers have lower charges overall, charges vary significantly by region and age. Analyzing these factors together can uncover regional and age-based patterns relevant for risk assessment and pricing.
